subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: for mike E. and other new people
author: bruce halliday
full_text:
--_9a1f47e9-ddc4-4d81-b417-111ab3195574_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


Misty,
 
I'm not back here 5 minutes and already I am getting sarcastic no=
nsense.
I would not presume to say what you have had luck with in the past,=
 so why do you do that with me.
 
Anyway I am not worried about using water=
 or lasers or anything else. I am a box researcher.
And a damn good one. An=
d if by helping me you suggested sweeping the dial manually then yes you di=
d.
but that's all you did. I have taken box research light years beyond any=
one one that was here when I got here.
 
So please I'm asking nicely, even =
though we have had our differences in the past. 
 
Please do not try to bai=
t me into a confrontation.
I will not ablige, I just want to be here and he=
lp who ever I can.
Please just let me do that. I assure you anything I say =
is just my personal opinion.
So please let it go I do not want to be on the=
 recieving end of any negative activity.
 
thanks
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


T=
o: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: bulletbabea@...: Wed, 19 Mar 2008=
 17:01:45 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: for mike E. and other new people




=
Bruce Perhaps it is just that you had such difficulty using other methods. =
I remember when we were helping you using other methods evpmaker and the sw=
eep method and then you got your first box. I think over time we all develo=
ped our contact field and the communication becomes stronger. Again method =
doesnt matter its the intent and the dedication that helps us get better co=
mmunication going with the other side. The boxes are an exciting tool, unfo=
rtunately not everyone can hear them live, same goes for the other methods =
not everyone can hear what comes thru. Once the connection is made and they=
 speak freely and we can hear them better, then the options are endless =3D=
)For most when starting out theres a period of time to train the ears to he=
ar them. It would be nice if we could all skip that part of the drill. Eith=
er way once you start making connection and you have trained your ears, you=
r results can improve.Misty--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday <=
paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:>> > Misty,> > You are right to a certai=
n extent, I have found in my experience> that traditional evp does not lend=
 itself to astral communication.> > It is more for field investigation and =
capturing grounded spirits.> Personally I feel that each individual is comf=
ortable with their own> style of spirit communication. For the new people, =
The information> I give about box research and para research in general com=
es from personal > of experience.> > Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > To: EVP-IT=
C@...: bulletbabea@...: Wed, 19 Mar 2008 16:14:32 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] R=
e: for mike E. and other new people> > > > > I agree with some of what Bruc=
e said. But dont go throwing out everything you have learned about ITC rese=
arch it STILL applies no matter what method you are using you are building =
a bridge of contact. I get alot of the same voices coming thru no matter wh=
at method I use. There are many ways they can manipulate sound whether its =
using evpmaker, the boxes, water, laser, spiricom, etc.As for it being the =
only live method that is not quite true either some of the other methods al=
low you to hear some of the feedback you get live too (if you can hear them=
).The basic rule of thumb is to remember there are no experts. Try it and s=
ee what works best for you and your own hearing.Misty--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups.com, bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@> wrote:>> > mike,> > I'm=
 sorry I was not around when you started, I guess no one took the time to e=
xplain boxes and box research to you.> Well here is a crash course!> > I do=
n't know what your experience is with evp_itc or any other form of spirit c=
ommunication, but whatever you have learned about capturing and analyzing t=
raditional EVP, has to be thrown right out the window. > Box research is a =
horse of a whole different color. The basic premise for traditional evp cap=
ture is that the spirit or entity that is grounded or in visitation at a se=
t location, will manipulate the ambient energy available to it that surroun=
ds the recording medium, be it a digital or analog recorder. It uses this e=
nergy, usually thought to be EMF energy to place an asimally of a voice ont=
o the recorder. The recording is then uploaded to a computer and is gone ov=
er by the researcher/investigator to search for these little whispered voic=
es on the recording. This traditional way of gathering spirit communication=
 serves it's purpose or at least has served it's purpose. > > When you deci=
ded to pick up a box, everything you ever learned about spirit communicatio=
n ceased to apply. Box communication in a nutshell, no matter what type of =
box you use is run on the same premise. The box or radio is made to sweep t=
he dial fast enough so that no stable or whole radio signal is captured. Th=
e signal is therefore fragmented into small bits of sound and fragments of =
human speech. The idea is for our spirit friends to be able to manipulate t=
he fragments of sound to form intelligible words, phrases and messages that=
 we can understand clearly.> > As you know the major factor in the differen=
ce between box research and traditional EVP is the fact that you can and mo=
st certainly do hear spirit communication through a box live and in real ti=
me.> That's what sets this apart from any other paranormal communication re=
search in the world or even the history of paranormal research.> > The rese=
arch you are embarking on now will take time and patience to become accusto=
med too but eventually with experience comes stronger communication, a bett=
er relationship between you and your spirit tech/guides and a better ear fo=
r hearing and discerning spirit communication from ordinary radio noise.> >=
 this is just a quick explanation but don't worry anyone here that knows me=
 can tell you there will be much more to come.> > The reason I started this=
 reply was your reference to class a EVP, in box research there is no such =
thing, you either hear it or you don't.> > Mike my ears and my mouth are al=
ways open so any questions, don't hesitate.> > Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > =
To: EVP-ITC@: f1cracker75@: Tue, 18 Mar 2008 14:42:44 -0700Subject: RE: [EV=
P-ITC] New file uploaded to EVP-ITC> > > > > > Hi Bruce, yeah I am new to t=
he group. 4 weeks now. I have other files loaded, and only load what is clo=
ser to class "A" EVP. > > I am using the radio shack hack 12-469.> > I reco=
rd usually in the morning. I work from home, and wait until the kids and wi=
fe are out of the house, so I have no interruptions.> > My personal interes=
t is to make contact with my family members and friends that have passed on=
. I have so many questions to ask them, etc....> > Tips are welcome.. I sti=
ll am playing with the sound of the radio when in scan mode. Trying to get =
the volume just right where if i did hear a spirit, the sound of the radio =
does not drown it out.> > Any advice you can give me after listening to my =
files, that would be great!> > Mike Edwards Cary NCbruce halliday <paranorm=
alinvestigating@> wrote:> > > Hi Mike, I have just returned to this group a=
fter a short absence.My name is Bruce I have exstensive experience with box=
 research and do my own research with every type of box that is available i=
ncluding the newest Frank's box that is out.I hear a female response saying=
 "YES" at the very end of the file. What box are you using? if you can Mike=
 keep your questions as short and to the point as possible, the longer your=
 speaking the more chance of stepping on a message or answer.Plus the short=
er and more direct the question the easier it will be for them to answer in=
 a reasonable ammount of time. If you don't mind me asking, how long are yo=
u involved in box research? I do not remember you the last time I participa=
ted here. If you have any questions or I can help you with anything just le=
t me know. Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > From: EVP-ITC@: EVP-ITC@: Tue, 18 Ma=
r 2008 18:37:24 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] New file uploaded to EVP-ITC> > > H=
ello,This email message is a notification to let you know thata file has be=
en uploaded to the Files area of the EVP-ITC group.File : /Mike Edwards Fil=
es/Question to Shay Clark and a voice said yes.wav Uploaded by : f1cracker7=
5 <f1cracker75@> Description : I asked a deceased friend named Shay Clark i=
f he could help me get in touch with my father who died in 1987. I believe =
I received a yes. Please advise if any of you hear different. The yes is ne=
ar the end You can access this file at the URL:http://groups.yahoo.com/grou=
p/EVP-ITC/files/Mike%20Edwards%20Files/Question%20to%20Shay%20Clark%20and%2=
0a%20voice%20said%20yes.wav To learn more about file sharing for your group=
, please visit:http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/groups/original/members/web=
/index.htmlfilesRegards,f1cracker75 <f1cracker75@>> > Connect and share in =
new ways with Windows Live. Get it now! > > > > Looking for last minute sho=
pping deals? Find them fast with Yahoo! Search. > > > > > > > > ___________=

arts! Play the word scramble challenge with star power.> http://club.live.c=
om/star_shuffle.aspx?icid=3Dstarshuffle_wlmailtextlink_jan> > > > > > > > _=

 score, the latest news, or you need your Hotmail=AE-get your "fix".> http:=
